summary: This document is an email chain discussing the Bureau of Prisons' policy for daily visits to Special Housing Units (SHU). It highlights a discrepancy between the written policy requiring specific visits by lieutenants and the generic post orders at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. The correspondence involves an Acting Warden and a Special Investigative Agent.

keyFacts: Bureau of Prisons Policy Statement 5270.11 requires daily visits to segregated inmates in Special Housing Units by qualified health personnel and designated officers, with a Lieutenant required to visit during each shift.

The Acting Warden of MCC New York notes that the actual Lieutenant Post Orders at the facility are generic, stating only to 'Conduct Rounds of the institution,' with no specific instruction for SHU rounds.
This correspondence, dated July 14, 2021, highlights a potential procedural gap between written policy and implemented post orders at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
